info.title: Paycard Usage Expansions
info.description: This API is used to read Paycard Usage Expansion details like Geogrhapical boundries.

parameters.name: roleCode
parameters.description: The role the user is playing during the transaction.  Possible values: employee,manager,practitioner,administrator,supervisor.  The roleCode header will be passed in all calls. When coming from Myself capabilities rolecode=employee. When coming from Team capabilities roleCode=manager. When coming from Practitioner capabilities roleCode=practitioner.

parameters.name: roleCode
parameters.description: The role the user is playing during the transaction.  Possible values: employee,manager,practitioner,administrator,supervisor.  The roleCode header will be passed in all calls. When coming from Myself capabilities rolecode=employee. When coming from Team capabilities roleCode=manager. When coming from Practitioner capabilities roleCode=practitioner.

CardholdersCardsUsageExpansion.title: CardholdersCardsUsageExpansion
CardholdersCardsUsageExpansion.description: Card Usage Expansion for each card

itemID.description: The unique identifier of the related cardh within a collection

cardID.description: Alternate ID to uniquly identify card

geoGraphicalBoundries.description: Provides details on Carholder travel plan, which get used to validate card transaction when card is not used in home address

actions.description: Actions which the user is allowed to initiate against the related entity based on the context

CardAccount.title: CardAccount
CardAccount.description: The bank account associated with the card

accountNumber.description: The simple (string) identifier of an object

IDType_v02.title: IDType_v02
IDType_v02.description: The unique identifier of the related entity

codeType_v02.title: codeType_v02
codeType_v02.description: The code for the related entity.  If this is a coded value, codeValue and shortName should be used. If this is just a string value, only shortName is necessary

codeValue.description: The code for the related entity

shortName.description: Short description of the related code

longName.description: Long description of the related code

countryCode.description: A simple (string) code.  Can have a code list reference

itemID.description: The unique identifier of the related cardh within a collection

countrySubdivisionType_v02.title: countrySubdivisionType_v02
countrySubdivisionType_v02.description: A country sub-division correlating to a administrative level one or two levels below country. For example, in the United States, this might be a state or a county

codeValue.description: The code for the related entity

shortName.description: Short description of the related code

longName.description: Long description of the related code

subdivisionType.description: The type of a country sub-division, e.g. state, county

datePeriodType_v02.title: datePeriodType_v02
datePeriodType_v02.description: The string reprersentation of the date range. Used to specify effective period.  Follows the ISO-8601:2000 format

startDate.description: The string representation of the date value. Follows the ISO-8601:2000 format

startTime.description: The startTime represented as hh:mm. This is communicated in military notation and presented in the UI based on the timeNotationCode

endDate.description: The string representation of the date value. Follows the ISO-8601:2000 format

endTime.description: The endTime represented as hh:mm. This is communicated in military notation and presented in the UI based on the timeNotationCode.

actionType_v02.title: actionType_v02
actionType_v02.description: Actions which the user is allowed to initiate against the related entity

operationID.description: Identifies the operation of an action

canonicalUri.description: The URI of the related entity

sequence.description: Sequence of a related entity when included in the collection or a group

ActionTypeCode.title: ActionTypeCode
ActionTypeCode.description: Identifies the type of action to be taken to fulfill the request.  Action can be a callback to a service to complete the action.  A callback requires the methodCode and uris to be returned.  An external link i.e. open a web page - requires the uris of the external link; An object reference is a reference to a related object within the application.  This is a canonical name which represents the object.  Based on this identifier, the application knows what view it needs to open.  The uris returns the data for the view.  For an object reference, the objectRefID, methodCode, and uris are required . modify indicates that a property is being modified

attestationType_v02.title: attestationType_v02
attestationType_v02.description: Optional text provided to the user when they take an action to affirm to be correct, true, or genuine. Requires confirmation indicator to be set to true

messageTxt.description: Message to present to the user.  This is mutuallly exclusive with the messageUri which is an external link to the message.  If the text is sizable and fairly static then it should be an external link which may be cached

messageUri.description: The URI of the related entity

linkType_v02.title: linkType_v02
linkType_v02.description: A link description object is used to describe link relations.  In the context of a schema, it defines the link relations of the instances of the schema, and can be parameterized by the instance values.  The link description format can be used on its own in regular (non-schema documents), and use of this format can be declared by referencing the normative link description schema as the the schema for the data structure that uses the links

href.description: The URI of the related entity

canonicalUri.description: The URI of the related entity

title.description: This property defines a title for the link.  The value must be a string. User agents MAY use this title when presenting the link to the user

targetSchema.description: This property is a schema that defines the expected structure of the JSON representation of the target of the link, if the target of the link is returned using JSON representation

schema.description: This property contains a schema which defines the acceptable structure of the submitted request.  For a GET request, this schema would define the properties for the query string and for a POST request, this would define the body

Rel.title: Rel
Rel.description: Indicates the nature of the relationship of the related resource to the resource that generated this representation

MediaType.title: MediaType
MediaType.description: The media type that the linked resource will return (Response)

Method.title: Method
Method.description: The HTTP method code (HTTP Verb) traverse the link (GET, POST, PUT or DELETE)

EncType.title: EncType
EncType.description: If present, this property indicates a query media type format that the server supports for querying or posting to the collection of instances at the target resource.  The query can be suffixed to the target URI to query the collection with property-based constraints on the resources that SHOULD be returned from the server or used to post data to the resource (depending on the method). (Request)

argumentPath.description: Code value (typically a key field) of the code list item

argumentValue.description: Code value (typically a key field) of the code list item

confirmMessageType_v01.title: confirmMessageType_v01
confirmMessageType_v01.description: The ConfirmMessage contains the processing results for the corresponding request.  A request may have its processing reported as: succeeded, partially failed, or failed.

createDateTime.description: The string reprersentation of the date-time value. Follows the ISO-8601:2000 format

requestReceiptDateTime.description: The string reprersentation of the date-time value. Follows the ISO-8601:2000 format

requestETag.description: The entity tag of the entity in the request.

processMessages.description: processMessage is optional and contains processing information for either the request (at the ConfirmMessage level) or a resource being managed in the request (at the ResourceMessage level).  Most often there will be a single instance for an associated request or resource, but this structure allows for more than one if needed, for example, if multiple errors exist for a single resource.

resourceMessages.description: resource Message contains the resource-specific processing results for resources being managed in the request.  A resource may have its processing reported as:  succeeded or failed.  It must be used to represent resource-specific messages.  In the case of a request managing multiple resources and resource-specific messages are to be returned, then this array will contain one object for each such resource of the request.

queryOptionCode.description: A simple (string) code.  Can have a code list reference

obligationCode.description: A simple (string) code.  Can have a code list reference

queryOptionTypeCode.description: A simple (string) code.  Can have a code list reference

resourcePathMax.description: Maximum number of resource paths supported

pattern.description: Indicates a regular expression on the required pattern for the value

resourcePaths.description: A collection of acceptable resource paths to pass to the query option

excludedResourcePaths.description: A collection of resource paths which may not be passed to the query option.  An example use of this is where you allow all paths except 1 or 2.  You would want to only specify those which are excluded

foreignKey.description: Allows for filtering the code list

logicalOperatorCode.description: A simple (string) code.  Can have a code list reference

mutuallyExclusiveLogicalOperatorCodes.description: A list of mutually exclusive operator codes.

minItems.description: Indicates the minimum items required for an array type.  This is only relevant if the given property is an array.

maxItems.description: Indicates the maximum items supported for an array type.  This is only relevant if the given property is an array.

sameValueProperties.description: A list of properties which must have the exact same value within the array

uniqueProperties.description: A list of properties which together must be unique

dependencies.description: List conditional dependencies of supported properties (readOnly, pattern, hidden, disallow etc.) of an attribute or an object. Dependencies can be defined using oneOf (OR) / allOf (AND) object. oneOf - successful if one of the conditions satisfies, allOf - successful if all the conditions satisfies. Refer API specification for dependencies context object syntax and rules. Dependencies context cannot be validated against context schema if dependencies is defined context JSON, because the dependencies JSON structure is dynamically defined for attributes and the not defined in the context schema. Attribute level properties and dependencies properties are mutually exclusive, example - readOnly property can be set either at attribute level or inside dependencies. If both hidden and disallow properties are set inside dependencies or at attribute level, hidden property takes precedence.

helperMessageType.title: helperMessageType
helperMessageType.description: Helper text provided to the user when they take an action to affirm to be correct, true, or genuine.

messageTxt.description: Message to present to the user.

disallow.description: Specified on a target property.  If the passed conditions are true then this property is disallowed and therefore, not presented to a user.

shortLabelName.description: Provides a client defined UI label for the property which is less than an average of 20 characters in length.

longLabelName.description: Provides a client defined UI long label for the property.

minLength.description: Indicates the minimum length required for a property.

maxLength.description: Indicates the maximum length supported for a property

default.description: Indicates the default value which should be populated by default

pattern.description: Indicates a regular expression on the required pattern for the value

equals.description: Provides 1 to many properties which the value of this property must be equal to.  If the property is equal to any of the value of the properties then the validation is successful.

greaterThan.description: The value of the related property must be greater than the value of  all the given properties in the array.

lessThan.description: The value of the related property must be less than the value of all the given properties in the array.

Refer API specification for dependencies context object syntax and rules. Attribute level properties and dependencies properties are mutually exclusive, example - readOnly property can be set either at attribute level or inside dependencies.
